TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UserNameSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based upon a user name and password.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> class to provide authentication credentials in the form of a user name and password.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string userName, string password) cil managed

Docs.param: A user name. Sets the property.
A password for the user name. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified user name and password.

MemberSignature.Value: public UserNameSecurityToken (string userName, string password, string id);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string userName, string password, string id) cil managed

Docs.param: A user name. Sets the property.
A password for the user name. Sets the property.
A unique identifier of the security token. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified user name, password, and unique identifier.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
Docs.value: A unique identifier of the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.Id%2A> property is usually in the format of a URI with a GUID.

Docs.summary: Gets the password for the user name associated with the security token.
Docs.value: The password for the user name associated with the security token.

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Docs.value: A of type that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security tokens cannot be used for cryptographic operations, by default, so the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> property returns an empty collection.

Docs.summary: Gets the user name that is associated with the security token.
Docs.value: The user name that is associated with the security token.

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> token is valid. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> token is valid. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
